00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_vector.h -- Simple implementation of a vector class.
00023 
00024   Original Author: Stan Y. Liao, Synopsys, Inc.
00025 
00026   CHANGE LOG AT END OF FILE
00027  *****************************************************************************/
00028 
00029 #ifndef SC_VECTOR_H
00030 #define SC_VECTOR_H
00031 
00032 #include <vector>
00033 
00034 namespace sc_core {
00035 
00036 extern "C" {
00037   typedef int (*CFT)( const void*, const void* );
00038 } 
00039 
00040 
00041 // #define ACCESS(I) m_vector.at(I) // index checking
00042 #define ACCESS(I) m_vector[I]
00043 #define ADDR_ACCESS(I) (m_vector.size() != 0 ? &m_vector[I] : 0 )
00044 
00045 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 //  CLASS : sc_pvector<T>
00047 //
00048 //  Simple vector class.
00049 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00050 
00051 template< class T >
00052 class sc_pvector
00053 {
00054 public:
00055 
00056     typedef const T* const_iterator;
00057     typedef       T* iterator;
00058         // typedef typename ::std::vector<T>::const_iterator const_iterator;
00059         // typedef typename ::std::vector<T>::iterator       iterator;
00060 
00061     sc_pvector( int alloc_n = 0 )
00062         {
00063         }
00064 
00065     sc_pvector( const sc_pvector<T>& rhs )
00066         : m_vector( rhs.m_vector )
00067         {}
00068 
00069     ~sc_pvector()
00070         {}
00071 
00072 
00073     std::size_t size() const
00074         { return m_vector.size(); }
00075 
00076 
00077     iterator begin()
00078         { return (iterator) ADDR_ACCESS(0); }
00079 
00080     const_iterator begin() const
00081         { return (const_iterator) ADDR_ACCESS(0); }
00082 
00083     iterator end()
00084         { return static_cast<iterator> (ADDR_ACCESS(m_vector.size())); }
00085 
00086     const_iterator end() const
00087     { 
00088         return static_cast<const_iterator> (ADDR_ACCESS(m_vector.size()));
00089     }
00090 
00091 
00092     sc_pvector<T>& operator = ( const sc_pvector<T>& rhs )
00093         { m_vector = rhs.m_vector; return *this; }
00094 
00095 
00096     T& operator [] ( unsigned int i )
00097         { 
00098             if ( i >= m_vector.size() ) m_vector.resize(i+1);
00099             return (T&) m_vector.operator [] ( i );
00100         }
00101 
00102     const T& operator [] ( unsigned int i ) const
00103         { 
00104             if ( i >= m_vector.size() ) m_vector.resize(i+1);
00105             return (const T&) m_vector.operator [] ( i );
00106         }
00107 
00108     T& fetch( int i )
00109         { return ACCESS(i); }
00110 
00111     const T& fetch( int i ) const
00112         { return (const T&) ACCESS(i); }
00113 
00114 
00115     T* raw_data()
00116         { return (T*) &ACCESS(0); }
00117 
00118     const T* raw_data() const
00119         { return (const T*) &ACCESS(0); }
00120 
00121 
00122     operator const ::std::vector<T>& () const
00123         { return m_vector; }
00124 
00125     void push_back( T item )
00126         { m_vector.push_back( item ); }
00127 
00128 
00129     void erase_all()
00130         { m_vector.resize(0); }
00131 
00132     void sort( CFT compar )
00133         {qsort( (void*)&m_vector[0], m_vector.size(), sizeof(void*), compar );}
00134 
00135     /* These methods have been added from Ptr_Array */
00136     
00137     void put( T item, int i )
00138         { ACCESS(i) = item; }
00139 
00140     void decr_count()
00141         { m_vector.resize(m_vector.size()-1); }
00142 
00143     void decr_count( int k )
00144         { m_vector.resize(m_vector.size()-k); }
00145 
00146 
00147 
00148   protected:
00149     mutable ::std::vector<T> m_vector;    // Actual vector of pointers.
00150 };
00151 
00152 #undef ACCESS
00153 #undef ADDR_ACCESS
00154 
00155 } // namespace sc_core
